feed.title: Jake Zimmerman | Tree-sitter
feed.subtitle: A collection of blog posts about programming, software, types, programming languages, Sorbet, Vim, Markdown, and more.

entry.title: Is tree-sitter good enough?
entry.summary: While tree-sitter is a neat project with lots of valid use cases, it isn't a silver bullet for all parsing-related projects.

entry.title: Parse Error Recovery in Sorbet: Part 2

link.title: Parse Error Recovery in Sorbet: Part 2

entry.summary: This is the second post in a series about "things I've learned while making improvements to Sorbet's parser." Specifically, it's about approaches I considered but decided against.
